turns.utterance: I'm feeling really lost. I've been working in marketing for five years, but I'm just not excited about it anymore. I don't even know where to start looking for something new. It's all so overwhelming!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand. Feeling lost and overwhelmed is common when considering a career change. Let's start by identifying your skills and interests. What aspects of your current marketing role do you enjoy, if any? And what are some activities or hobbies outside of work that genuinely excite you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Well, I'm good at data analysis and presenting findings. I guess I like that part. Outside of work, I really enjoy volunteering at the animal shelter and I'm also into photography. But how can I turn *that* into a career? It seems impossible to make a living doing those things!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's excellent information! Combining your analytical skills with your interests could open some interesting doors.
